attributes.action: Reinstate the 1% Cap on Rail Fares
attributes.additional_details:
The coalition government plans to reduce the cap on rail fares from January 2012.

Under Labour, fare increases on many lines were limited to the rate of inflation plus 1%. However, from 2012 this will increase to inflation plus 3%.

If inflation remains at the level it is now, around 4%, this could mean a 7% increase in fares in 2012.

The government must reinstate the cap at its former level to reduce the burden on commuters and support sustainable transport.
